intro: Anaphyllopsis, commonly known as the sea holly, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive blue or purple flowers and feathery foliage. The plant is native to coastal regions of the Mediterranean and the eastern coast of North America. Anaphyllopsis species typically grow in sandy or gravelly soils and are adapted to saline environments. They are often used in ornamental gardening due to their striking appearance and hardy nature.
